website_summaries.verdict: Individually adjustable legs, lightweight and highly portable. Sturdy and accessible build with a weight capacity of up to 1,000 pounds.
pros: Super lightweight, yet strong enough to withstand up to 1,000 pounds
Individually adjustable legs enable you to position it on uneven surfaces
Rubber feet will prevent any slipping
Folds down to a compact 2 inches, and has an impressive 7 to 8 inch height when fully extended
cons: A small number of users find the release mechanism to be fiddly

customer_reviews.title: Great Stool But......
customer_reviews.text: We purchased our original step stool about four years ago in June 2014. The stool is great! It’s very sturdy, easy to put up and put down and easy to clean. The only problem we had with the stool and it’s major flaw is on the corners of the stool. If you try to put too much weight on any one corner of the fixture that connects the leg to the platform it may buckle the welded point which completely Damages the unit. Up until this one incident we had not one issue with the stool. We are now purchasing a second stool and we are going to keep that in mind for our future adventures. Enjoy!
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie Dozier

customer_reviews.title: The Right Step
customer_reviews.text: This was the right step for allowing us to step in and out of our motorhome without a problem. The step is very sturdy and is adjustable which allows for even more flexibility. Arrived as promised and no issues with the condition of the step. Very Nice!
customer_reviews.author: William Roche

customer_reviews.title: ... 8 months and it is well made and works great BUT one of the Rubber feet came off and ...
customer_reviews.text: I have had this step for about 8 months and it is well made and works great BUT one of the Rubber feet came off and got lost and CAMCO does not make ANY replacement parts for this step and the Stromberg-Carlson rubber feet will not fit the Camco step. So if you have to replace a rubber foot you are OUT OF LUCK but Stromberg Carlson (PA-250) had replacement parts for their steps!!
customer_reviews.author: Scott J.

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy Step
customer_reviews.text: We have not yet used this step. The legs are easy to fold down but adjusting the height is really hard. Our grips are not strong enough anymore and trying to pry the nibs down into the hole to adjust is a waste of time. If you remove the feet, use a long nose plier down through the inside to move the nib to the side. Then adjust the height and slide the nib back. This is a pain but we need the step. Have another idea and will post if it works. Hope the manufacturer is paying attention.
customer_reviews.author: LPLoveland

customer_reviews.title: Leg buttons work poorly, 1/2 in gap between slats
customer_reviews.text: Just arrived today. Already had issues on the adjustable button getting stuck up inside the leg and not moving into the correct position. I question it's long term durability. The legs are not at all easy to adjust and I am not feeble. Second issue is the half inch gap between each slat on the step surface. I bought this foe my small dogs also to use and will have to purchase a mat and adhere it to the step to cover those large gaps to keep a paw or leg from slipping down between the slats. Over all disappointed. 😕
customer_reviews.author: D.Mor.

customer_reviews.title: Very nice addition
customer_reviews.text: This is the perfect extra step out of the RV. It's a little difficult to adjust heights, but each leg is independently adjustable, so it's perfect of uneven ground. Last time I used it, it rained, and when I turned it over to close it, water came out of the platform tubes. I will be drilling drain holes... I'm 6'5", 275lbs and it handles me no problem. I've tried the little plastic steps, and DIY knock-down plywood steps; this is the solution. Definite recommendation.
customer_reviews.author: D. Mannon

customer_reviews.title: Difficult to adjust leg length
customer_reviews.text: This is a very strong step, mostly well made, except for the ease of adjusting leg length. It is not possible to push in the buttons far enough to allow the leg length to be set at another hole. The metal push button gets stuck on the corner of the hole of the metal leg which prevents the leg from sliding past the button. I fixed this by tapering the hole openings of the leg with a drill. This allowed the metal button to contact a sloping surface in the hole on the leg rather than a sharp edged hole. This took some time as there are a lot of holes that need to be tapered.
customer_reviews.author: Jmk

customer_reviews.title: Works great as first camper step
customer_reviews.text: For the last couple of years I have been using a section of 6x6 as a first step for our camper. After almost twisting my ankle twice last year camping I decided I needed a better solution. Stumbled across this unit. It is super sturdy and easily supports a lot of weight. The adjustable legs don't give you too much height adjustment but has been great for uneven ground where you can extend a leg to make it level (not rocking). The wide platform, easy adjustment and folding legs make it perfect as a step and easy to pack away in the camper.
customer_reviews.author: kajoiner

customer_reviews.title: mechanical action of the legs works well and has good grip. We use it for our camper and ...
customer_reviews.text: Well made, light weight, mechanical action of the legs works well and has good grip. We use it for our camper and it helps us avoid that big first step. Camper step in the photo is 25", Camco Step is 19"
customer_reviews.author: Bill Esposito

customer_reviews.title: Good platform quality but hard to adjust
customer_reviews.text: Likes: Speed of delivery, great product quality overall, solid performance. Dislikes: Hard to adjust legs. Quality of leg hardware not great. Top of legs made of thin ferrous metal. Product comes assembled at lowest level, which would have been ideal. Unfortunately, I needed to raise the legs about 2 inches. I ended up taking off the legs, placing in a vise, putting a c-clamp on the release tabs, then hammering into place with a piece of wood stock. Had this product come with non-adjustable legs, I might have considered 5 star.
customer_reviews.author: D. Lee

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy trailer step stool
customer_reviews.text: Great product except for the buttons that must be pushed in to change the leg length or fold the legs under the platform. The problem is not the pin spring but pushing the pin into the leg with your finger and not cutting the tip of your finger on the sharp edge of the hole in the leg. I tried many ways to push with my finger and still injure my finger. Perhaps the manufacturer could provide a hand tool to push in the pin and include a bracket under the platform to store the tool so it is always available.
customer_reviews.author: Un Sargent

customer_reviews.title: Not so adjustable height.
customer_reviews.text: The adjustable legs do not adjust with any reasonable effort. the two push pins per leg that need to be depressed to adjust the legs can not be pushed in far enough by hand to allow legs to be adjusted. both my wife and I tried to adjust all for legs and were not able to get any of them to work. we are familiar with this type of mechanism and know how it is supposed to function. I returned this product.
customer_reviews.author: B. Hawley

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, but difficult to adjust
customer_reviews.text: Like a rock, but I found it frustratingly difficult to adjust the leg lengths. The little push pins are in tiny holes, and I had difficulty pushing them in far enough while pulling down the leg. The holes are too small for your finger to push them in far enough, and the legs don't slide easily. I ended up using a pencil to push in the tab far enough to release the leg.
customer_reviews.author: Satz

customer_reviews.title: Best and most useful step for 5th wheels or motorhomes
customer_reviews.text: This is so well made, sturdy and adjustable too! I never have to worry about slipping or falling with this step. It is so very sturdy that it handles unlevel ground like a charm. The non-skid strips provide a safe surface to step even in rain. I won't travel without one. I like that this one has adjustable heights so you can make it the perfect step height. My first one that I have had for 9 years was not adjustable. Strong, my gosh - you never have to worry about larger guests or carrying heavy loads when stepping on it.
customer_reviews.author: Melanie P. Moses

customer_reviews.title: RV Steps.  Legs are pain to adjust.
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed in this product. I needed to adjust the legs out as far as it would go. I ended up having to take the rubber feet off and get a pair of long nose needle nose pliers to push the release buttons back into the holes. With legs all the way out the legs won’t fold. However I am fortunate that legs will stay in same position as this will be used in one spot all the time. However if I had to fold up to travel I would have to return this product. Not sure how it is a top product as it is poorly made regarding extended legs.
customer_reviews.author: GiggleTiger22

customer_reviews.title: Great alternative to Aerobic Step Boxes
customer_reviews.text: Great step for my wife to do a hip rehab exercise routine. This thing is SOLID and has no give! Very nicely built. Doesn't slip on the floor and the top surface has a great no slip surface (I am 230 lbs). I am so much happier with this item than the cheap plastic aerobic steps that were the other choices. Price was really good as well - especially compared to choices that were made for exercise. Love the adjustable leg height, and I was able to hit a 9" step height that her trainer recommended. For step exercise, I strongly suggest you consider this vs the purpose built exercise platforms. Couldn't be happier with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Roy Baty

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend - didn't realize how handy
customer_reviews.text: Love this! First time we used it, we were on unlevel and slanted ground not to mention it was raining so muddy. Great time to review! Was able to adjust legs individually to make level, adjust height due to rear-hi camper and put down normal steps. Now had 3 level and safe steps to get in rv easier! No slipping, easy to sweep clean but really didnt need it - stayed nice and clean yet gaps for first and grip to wipe shoes. 10/10 for us!
customer_reviews.author: Gale at excite

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Step
customer_reviews.text: I was using a plastic step for my CTC (cargo trailer camper) build that made me nervous every time I put weight on it. I bought this blindly not knowing or having seen it before. I love this step. It is wide and deep with non-skid to make for a sure footed step. The legs are adjustable in height to make it perfect for your stride or step height. Legs fold for easy storage and it is lightweight aluminum. The perfect step!
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Woods

customer_reviews.title: An extra wide platform with even wider foot spacing.
customer_reviews.text: Better than we had hoped for. We needed an additional short step to ease the step up into our 2016 Minnie Winnie 25B, and this was perfect. While its height is adjustable, the out of the box adjustment was perfect for our needs. The wide footing makes it rock solid stable, and you get the feeling that if you drove over it; it would survive. Okay, that's a bit much, but you get the idea. Would highly recommend to other RV travelers.
customer_reviews.author: Dotty's Mom

customer_reviews.title: Very Stable on level surfaces
customer_reviews.text: I got this to use with my pickup truck side steps to give my elderly parents a larger step for getting into my truck. I have the Advance Research folding steps and they deploy down to a height that works with the product to help them get in. Other than for when I transport them somewhere, It will be stored in back under my bed cover.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Essential for our travel trailer
customer_reviews.text: I love this adjustable height step for our camping trailer. It folds flat and is easy to pop the legs out. It has non-slip rubber feet to secure the step and keep it stable. When the ground is not level, I can adjust each leg of the step independently to compensate. Easy to use and easy to pack... win-win!!
customer_reviews.author: W. Knight

customer_reviews.title: Best camp step
customer_reviews.text: So sturdy you would think it were attached like the other steps. It can have pinch points while collapsing and adjusting so leave that for adults to do. It is wonderful for ground under the last step which isn't quite level and the adjustable legs make it so much safer to enter and exit. We went through two other recommended steps before we found this one that I'm recommending.
customer_reviews.author: Frosty Mug

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: I found it pretty hard to unfold but once in place it does the job. Wiggles a little with the legs extended but so far so good. This is heavy and all metal, so think it will last. Happy w the purchase. Not super convenient to fold and unfold but that's not really why I bought it. It does what it is supposed to do.
customer_reviews.author: Tomusama

customer_reviews.title: Folding step
customer_reviews.text: This is a great investment for RVing and home use. We use it traveling in our car too. You know how tall beds in some motels and hotels are. Well this is the ticket for making it easier to get onto the bed. Some family and friends have lifted trucks and we bring the step along with us when we ride along with them. This step of many applications is really great, easy to set up and extremely sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Coache

customer_reviews.title: Great step up for my 16' Scamp
customer_reviews.text: Great step up for my 16' Scamp! I applied a plastic grass door mat cut to fit to the top with zipties. The other half of the mat goes just inside the door of the camper. It's just the right height to step in. I am adding that I have never folded the step and don't plan to as I can just put it in my truck when I go camping. So, I can't address the ease of adjustment. I have another step from Harbor Freight that I place over this one 90 degrees, providing me 2 steps up into my camper. But in the driveway I just use this one.
customer_reviews.author: Amazonian Knitter

customer_reviews.title: Useful step!
customer_reviews.text: I needed a step for the Fifth Wheel Camper cause i had to step up unlock the door step down to swing the door and i got so tired of doing that so this works for me. Now the second reason is we have a Mastiff that was having some difficulties with the camper steps so we thought this would work for him also and bingo it works for him no more stumbling dog. This step is sturdy, no slipping, weight limit is fantastic and we have no complaints@
customer_reviews.author: Brenda B.

customer_reviews.title: makes a great step for rv trailer
customer_reviews.text: liked the adjustability, but they adjust poorly and really sometimes need 2 people as the push points are difficult at time. once they are adjusted, they are fine...just neede a little more thought on the adjustment pins. I gave these to my son as bday gift...personally i went to not adjustable.
customer_reviews.author: blacklisted

customer_reviews.title: Very good
customer_reviews.text: We have an RV and these are the best little/big steps on the market I feel. You can adjust each leg separately if the ground is uneven legs are big enough so they do not easily sink in the ground. Fold down to just a couple of inches for storage. I think an elephant could step on these and not break them. May buy another set for my truck to get in and out of the bed. Highly recommend!!
customer_reviews.author: R K.

customer_reviews.title: This item saved the 4 week RV vacation that I ...
customer_reviews.text: This item saved the 4 week RV vacation that I just finished up. Our original step got damaged beyond usable and both my wife and I struggle to make the first high step into the RV (bad senior knees). We were nowhere near a store that sold this item. RV resort agreed to accept the package so ordered for overnight delivery. Step delivered early afternoon next day which based on our location was near miraculous. Amazon nailed it and we finished vacation in comfort. Product is stable, correct size, and lighter than our original one(RIP). Thank you to all Amazon employees involved in this. J&J RV travel addicts.
customer_reviews.author: Jack Schaefer

customer_reviews.title: VERY helpful product
customer_reviews.text: Mother has issues getting into bed. Found she had been using a decorative stool to do this Platform provides, in addition to a stable frame, 4 times the surface area to maneuver getting into her bed thus helping to reduce potential falls.
customer_reviews.author: Tom. Davis

customer_reviews.title: Great Step!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product, works very well! Sturdy and durable. I gave it a four, due to the fact they don't make parts, legs for this... One of mine broke, due to a neighbor camper running it over with their trailer... Never damaged any other part of it but the leg. Tried just buying the leg with no luck... So I did purchase another one.
customer_reviews.author: Margaret

customer_reviews.title: Great For RV and More!
customer_reviews.text: We bought this step so my mother-in-law would be able to get in and out of our motorhome without falling. After a 3 1/2 week, 6000 mile trip - it worked like a charm! And we all used it, including me - at 350 lbs. BUT THAT'S NOT ALL! Now we'll be using the step on a daily basis at home at our front stoop, since the RV will be in storage for the winter. This is a well-built, extremely sturdy, and fully adjustable step for lots of purposes.
customer_reviews.author: Ronald J. Benson

customer_reviews.title: Adjustment of leg height is nearly impossible
customer_reviews.text: I was very disappointed that I had not read the one star reviews. The reviews were correct that two buttons you need to push to adjust the leg height make it almost impossible to adjust the legs. The button to fold the leg works well but not the height buttons. The rest of the stool seems solid so was surprised that the adjustment is near impossible to do even for a handy person.
customer_reviews.author: Ted

customer_reviews.title: What a great product!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this step for our RV based on other reviews, but when we actually got it in, wow! Super strong and stable. Folds up really well for storage, and the adjustability is perfect when we have had to make adjustments to make it taller. We just can't say enough about how good this step is.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Pelletier

customer_reviews.title: Strong step for getting into a tall truck
customer_reviews.text: Great large step. I use it to help my old lab climb into my high F150 truck. The step can hold a lot of weight. A little hard to fold up so I leave it open and put it in my truck bed because I use it whenever my dog travels with me. I recommend this heavy duty step. I had a lower weight limit step that broke. This step can take a beating.
customer_reviews.author: Vaike

customer_reviews.title: Good but not aluminum
customer_reviews.text: Is adjustable and is stable. Is NOT aluminum as advertised. Would have preferred aluminum to the powder coated steel that arrived - both for lighter weight and corrosion resistance.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy M.

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy!
customer_reviews.text: Heavy duty! More than I expected. No issues with release buttons as in some reviews. 1/2” slots to let debris through. I Hope dogs toe doesn’t get stuck. I might fill them with wood or rubber. Looks like a good, solid product.
customer_reviews.author: Louie

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy little workhorse!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product! Bought it to make it easier to get in and out of our teardrop camper. We took it camping with us, and wonder how we ever lived without it. Sets up and folds down beautifully. We have used it around the house as well. A little pricey, but worth every cent. Love this thing!
customer_reviews.author: Monica A. Armstrong

customer_reviews.title: Rock solid step stool
customer_reviews.text: I got this to help my 75 y/o mother step into and out of my SUV. The platform is nice and big, raised all the way up or down, it's sturdy and stable as heck. The only knock I'd give it is the underside metal edges are a tad sharp and could lead to cutting yourself when folding it and storing it. Otherwise, I think I might buy a couple more for their utility around the house.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great steooing stool for our front door.
customer_reviews.text: We bought this as an extension to our front door on the RV. It works very well. Our only complaint is that the securing pins do not work well and must be pushed in with a key or some other items to work properly. This design flaw is easy to correct and I am sure it will be corrected by the company. Overall - a great product.
customer_reviews.author: Raymond A. Sowers

customer_reviews.title: A MUST HAVE!!!!
customer_reviews.text: LOVE LOVE LOVE! I am quite accident prone coming in and out if the trailer...so far this step has made life easier and saved me from falling. The hubby was skeptical at the thought of this purchase but even he is quite surprised how sturdy this is. A MUST HAVE FOR YOUR CAMPER!!!!
customer_reviews.author: shopoholic

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for creating a very stable extra "step" in/out of ...
customer_reviews.text: I use this step both inside and outside of my travel trailer. Perfect for creating a very stable extra "step" in/out of the camper beneath the factory stairs. I use this when the step-to-ground distance is too far for comfort. I also use this inside at night to access the camper bed. A thick memory foam mattress means more comfortable sleep, but the step makes it easier to access the higher-than-normal platform bed. I have the ubiquitous folding plastic step stool, but this is much more stable. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: Jomierbm

customer_reviews.title: Its well made and sturdy. The adjustment of the feet can be a ...
customer_reviews.text: the adjustable step is exactly what I was looking for our RV. It will replace a clunky wooden step the previous owner had made. BTW, the height varies from about 4 1/2 inches to 8 inches...I didn't measure yet. Its well made and sturdy. The adjustment of the feet can be a bit difficult as there are spring loaded releases that must be depressed and I didn't have any problems but I can see how others can. It folds up very compact for storage. A big plus in my book.
customer_reviews.author: Robert W Fuller

customer_reviews.title: Bullet proof.
customer_reviews.text: Very nice, stable, adjustable, large, heavy duty platform. This is not some small, little, wobbly step. You get what you pay for. Yes, it is a little more expensive than others but this is our second one (this one is for my work van - the first one is for our camp-trailer). Stout aluminum with no-slip tape on the treads. I would buy one again in a heartbeat.
customer_reviews.author: ah

customer_reviews.title: Great step for me
customer_reviews.text: Very stable I am 64 years old 6 foot 2 and about 300# with bad knees this little step helps me get out of motorhome in a big way. Definitely a 5 star plus
customer_reviews.author: Ronald A Berg

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy lifesaver!
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what we needed for an extra step into our Class C RV. The adjustable height has turned out to be a lifesaver, as we have yet to have the rig at the same height twice (due to hills and leveling requirements). My elderly mother loves the large step area and how sturdy it is. She no longer hesitates to step into the RV, and rarely has to use the side rail anymore (she has had two hip replacements and one knee replacement and before getting this step she had to pull herself up by the handrail and struggle to get into the rig). Huge lifesaver!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It's very sturdy; I use it with my Dodge Durango to ...
customer_reviews.text: It's very sturdy; I use it with my Dodge Durango to help some passengers have easier access getting in & out of the vehicle. My only complaint, as others have noted, is that the buttons to allow the legs to fold up are difficult to depress. I use my house key to get the job done, and since that key is with my key fob for the Durango, it's not a big inconvenience.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Bulson

customer_reviews.title: Well made and sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Adjustability is perfect for our uses as a step for our camper. Only problem we have is our dog gets his toes caught in the spaces between the slats. We put a small piece of carpeting over the top to solve the problem. He also uses it as a perch to watch what’s going on around our campsite.
customer_reviews.author: Beth C

customer_reviews.title: Camco Stool
customer_reviews.text: The step into our RV is a little too high for my wife to use comfortably, and this adjustable step solves that problem. I like the fit finish and overall construction. This unit is rated at 1000lbs, twice the capacity of most steps in this category
customer_reviews.author: Skugelstadt

customer_reviews.title: Very Sturdy Step
customer_reviews.text: This step is very sturdy and stable. I like the adjustable legs that make it easy to use on uneven ground. There is no flex even underneath my 300 pounds.
customer_reviews.author: Skip

customer_reviews.title: Solid, but HARD TO ADJUST without tools.
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy. I feel confident putting my 360 pound self on it. The legs are VERY DIFFICULT to adjust, however. You cannot adjust them with your fingers unless your skin is thicker that a rhino's. First, remove the rubber pads. Then use a narrow screwdriver to push first one, then the other, out of alignment, set the leg where you want it, and then guide the buttons back into place.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Just What I Needed
customer_reviews.text: Perfect companion for short people. I got very tired of climbing into and jumping out of my trailer. I needed something to bridge the gap between the one trailer step and the ground. I was tickled to take this camping, it makes all the difference. I highly recommend this wonderful step.
customer_reviews.author: D. Price

customer_reviews.title: Very strong
customer_reviews.text: Love this. We live in an RV so the first step is kinda high. We love this step helps out a lot for my dogs too.
customer_reviews.author: SusieQ

customer_reviews.title: Great, sturdy step!
customer_reviews.text: Our Logan trailer has a BIG first step! This is a great way to bridge the gap for short people! Love how easy it folds and how sturdy it is. You can change the height of one or more legs for uneven surfaces.
customer_reviews.author: Shawn Logan

customer_reviews.title: A+ on everything I was looking for
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a platform that was sturdy, light weight, foldable, easy to get up on and had lots of space for my feet. This was perfect. There was an alternate similar choice (at slightly higher cost) with adjustable legs that you can set to different heights in case your surface is not completely level. Others may find that useful, but I didn't see the need.
customer_reviews.author: Frank A. Hacker

customer_reviews.title: Great stool
customer_reviews.text: Great step to bring camping with us. It fits perfectly under our last camper step and is very sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Leslie Paille

customer_reviews.title: VERY sturdy and well made
customer_reviews.text: This stool has been amazing!! It’s very sturdy and solid!! Even for heavier people! It’s very easy to open, and easy to fold! I love the adjustable heights. We use it inside, and outside with our camper. It’s been the handiest stool we’ve had!
customer_reviews.author: Kelly Ocain

customer_reviews.title: Really well built.
customer_reviews.text: We really do like this stool/step. We bought it for our motorhome, the step isn't quite low enough, when it is leveled, and this helps us a lot, when going inside/outside, no more stretching out to get inside or out. Really sturdy built and I love the fact that it levels the legs too, with a little bit of help from me of course. Love my new step!!!!
customer_reviews.author: #1 Bon Bon Queen

customer_reviews.title: Light, strong, great traction, and adjustable
customer_reviews.text: I have a Jayco Talon ZX Toyhauler with a 2 step entrance stairstep. I am 6ft 1 inches and even for me it is a long step up from the ground to the first step. For my wife who is 5 ft 6 inches it is a real problem. This step makes it easy to get into our RV now. The black strips remind me of skateboard tape and give great traction. And the adjustable legs makes it easy to set it up level on uneven ground. And it is light on top of everything else. It is a great product that I am completely satisfied with. I don't get to say that often.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Awesome little stool. Bought it for my camper. The camper steps are always too high. Needed a stool to reach the first step. The legs adjust for uneven ground or just different heights. It’s a VERY solid stool. No give. I love it.
customer_reviews.author: Eric B.

customer_reviews.title: Good product, recommended
customer_reviews.text: Love it! The leg height adjustment pins are difficult to use because they're hard to push in. Still the adjustment is nice for uneven surfaces. The price is reasonable compared to the same products at near twice the cost.
customer_reviews.author: kristofuh

customer_reviews.title: VERY stable folding step
customer_reviews.text: This is a VERY sturdy and stable step platform - we use it to enable easy entry into our motorhome. It replaced two plastic steps which both broke with days of use (and we are 135 & 190 lbs). It was a bit higher, heavier and more $$ than I initially wanted, but now I appreciate it. Don't waste your money on a plastic step that may hurt you.
customer_reviews.author: Sue M.

customer_reviews.title: These Steps are hands down the best!
customer_reviews.text: I have bought three of these over the years for my trailers. One died an untimely death when I forgot it and drove over it. Other than that they are bullet proof.
customer_reviews.author: Claudia

customer_reviews.title: Robust, well-made and durable. Can't go wrong.
customer_reviews.text: Awesome step. My wife had difficulty with how much distance there was between the last step of our fifth wheel and the ground. We bought this and voila! Problem solved. Well-built. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: BrandonMag

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Motorhome Bottom Step
customer_reviews.text: My Class A motorhome has an electric double step that sometimes needs another bottom step when the leveling system brings the motorhome to a level condition. This step is very light, sturdy, while provideing a range of about 4 inches of adjustment and folds very flat for storage.
customer_reviews.author: GaryS

customer_reviews.title: Good size
customer_reviews.text: Size is good as it is easy to on and off of without having to worry about missing the step, unlike some smaller ones I have seen. If you have balance problems this is the one to get. With all four leg adjustable easy to get levelon unlevel ground.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce Davidge

customer_reviews.title: Built well!
customer_reviews.text: Very well built! Plenty of material and nice welds. The adjustable legs lock into place securely. I'm 250 lbs and bounced up & down on it, it's very sturdy! As a footnote, one rubber foot came off without me noticing it. I contacted Camco customer service. They are sending me two of them. Great customer service! I will be using rubber cement to glue the feet on.
customer_reviews.author: Becky & Pat  WA, state

customer_reviews.title: Very stable
customer_reviews.text: Gave 3 stars for easy to fold because the buttons on legs do not go in easy. One sticks all the time. When they work, it's good! Other wise I like the steps!
customer_reviews.author: Joanne

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Step
customer_reviews.text: Goes great with our new RV. Our new RV has two steps to enter but bottom step sits to low to the ground and the second step is set to close to the entry door. Many scraps to the chins and back of legs with RV steps. With this step it's large enough to stand on from toe to heal for full support
customer_reviews.author: Richard Roberts

customer_reviews.title: Solid
customer_reviews.text: Good size, big enough to be stable, small enough to toss in compartment for when the motorhome step is just a little to big for comfort. No flex when I (280 lbs) carry my grand kids (70 lbs) in for bed.
customer_reviews.author: Big B

customer_reviews.title: Great buy for the money
customer_reviews.text: I checked out many of this type of product. Wanted something sturdy and stable to use as an entry step into my RV. This adjustable stool is terrific. Very stable and no wobbles when you step onto it. I can jump on it and it won’t move or collapse. Products similar to this are way more expensive in RV stores and shops.
customer_reviews.author: Diana Gilkerson

customer_reviews.title: Best Step on the Market!
customer_reviews.text: We love this step is it quite sturdy and looks great! Even though our RV has adjustable height via air ride, we occasionally need this step and it works great! I am 250 lbs and even on grass it is very sturdy and does't squeak or make any noise!
customer_reviews.author: J.M. Norton

customer_reviews.title: Good at first but not durable over time!
customer_reviews.text: At first this was an excellent step but it is not durable over time! After owning it for 3 1/2 years the welds have started to crack and the aluminum has buckled rendering it useless. I contacted the manufacture about the defect and they stated they have a one-year warranty and there’s nothing they can do for their consumers after that. I guess I’ll have to go with another brand and Camco has lost a customer! Buyer beware !
customer_reviews.author: Dana King

customer_reviews.title: VERY NICE
customer_reviews.text: Very well constructed, Strong! Takes some effort to adjust the legs for various heights due to the tight tolerances. will become easier to adjust the legs when it "breaks" in with usage and some wear.
customer_reviews.author: michael cooper

customer_reviews.title: Wow!  Heavy Duty, Sturdy & Quality Build
customer_reviews.text: This is a very nice step. My wife is thrilled with it for that extra step to get from ground to the first step of the truck camper. It is solid as a rock and folds down into a very compact size for storage. Other steps are cheaper but at the end of the day the quality of this step was so fantastic I am glad I went with this one.
customer_reviews.author: PhilB

customer_reviews.title: Misleading height
customer_reviews.text: This thing is short, a standard cinder brick gives you more height. This thing will sink in the mud deeper than a standard cinder brick. I am over whelming under impressed with this step. Honestly, any cinder brick for the price is a better option.
customer_reviews.author: Not A Bear

customer_reviews.title: Great quality- Great Price
customer_reviews.text: Bought for an additional step for the Motorhome.. sometimes we need an extra step... it’s perfect! Very sturdy and safe.. one of the best things I have purchased for the RV!
customer_reviews.author: Griff

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, heavy, mine had defect
customer_reviews.text: The little buttons that allow you to expand or shorten the legs kept retracting into the legs. It was also too heavy for my 82 year old mother, who I purchased it for, to move.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon Grossman

customer_reviews.title: Great step stool
customer_reviews.text: Showed up on time great product a very well made easily to use lots of adjustment we use it for putting under their stares of our camper nice stool
customer_reviews.author: ark A.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Replacement
customer_reviews.text: Had one of the rubber feet crack on my Camco Folding Stool. These fit perfect. Look like good quality. I would definitely buy these again if needed.
customer_reviews.author: DaveToerper

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and Steady
customer_reviews.text: This is a great adjustable step for our RV. You can adjust the legs independently, so if you are on a slight slope you can make the step level. The legs are very sturdy and the step platform is larger than the standard one we had purchased in the past. The legs take a little effort to fold up for storage, but it is not a big issue.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis Bouchillon

customer_reviews.title: This thing is solid
customer_reviews.text: The legs fold under at any length so you don't have to collapse them to their shortest if they are at any other setting. I like that a lot along with it being really sturdy and non-skid as a result of the grip tape. I feel like it is exactly what is described and it is working well for me.
customer_reviews.author: Vintage Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Fabulous item
customer_reviews.text: I'm 5'1" with back issues so getting up the step to our RV can be a problem. Depending on the camp site there can be pretty high space to the first step. This stool is great. It's extremely sturdy and makes it easy to get to the first step.
customer_reviews.author: dsnrln

customer_reviews.title: Works perfectly
customer_reviews.text: I love that this step folds up. Our prior step did not fold and was a real PITA to store in the motor home bay. This step takes up less than half the depth of the older one. The price paid at Amazon was significantly cheaper than what I found anywhere else, so that was an especially great feature. The step is sturdy and I feel quite certain it will serve us for many years to come.
customer_reviews.author: AZTransplant

customer_reviews.title: sturdiness
customer_reviews.text: The sturdiness of this step is perfect. I also like that it is adjustable. Originally we had looked into replacing the stairs for our camper- $400+. Friends had purchased the Camco and it was just what we wanted. This step is greart AND it folds for storage always a plus with a camper.
customer_reviews.author: Grammy05

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy handy step for my new pickup.
customer_reviews.text: My elderly mother could not get into my new GMC pickup so I bought this to help. She loved the step and I made it much easier for her to get in and out of my truck. Sturdy aluminum construction and non slip top make this an all weather step. I took off one star because I had to take two of the legs off to push the locking adjustments into place but it was a minor issue for me.
customer_reviews.author: Tracy L. Gregg

customer_reviews.title: A solid step.
customer_reviews.text: Gives a much bigger platform, that's more stable than the step on our pop-up camper. The legs are adjustable, so you can level it out on uneven terrain. And they fold up for easy storage. Only thing I wish they did differently was to make it an inch taller, then it'd be perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The best stepstool I have ever owned or used
customer_reviews.text: The best stepstool I have ever owned or used. Heavy-duty construction built with lightweight material for a stable base. I purchased this to make it easier for my mother-in-law to get in and out of my truck And it is the perfect product if you're looking for an adjustable stable durable lightweight step this is the one
customer_reviews.author: JONATHAN LARMORE

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful step and versatile
customer_reviews.text: So glad we bought this step up for our camper. Depending upon the camping site, we can adjust the legs, and get that extra step needed to get in to the camper. Dries quickly, folds down nicely for storage. Very happy with the product.
customer_reviews.author: Charles W.  Ralsten

customer_reviews.title: Solid Step!
customer_reviews.text: This Platform is ideal for using with a Class B Motorhome. It has adjustable legs, rubber covering the leg bottoms. It closes up and it is easily stored until the next time you need it. My wife and I really enjoy this Platform, it makes getting in and out a breeze. Camco makes excellent products and this is but one of them.
customer_reviews.author: Toyboy

customer_reviews.title: Terrible Product
customer_reviews.text: This thing is worthless. I have had it less than 6 months, and hardly used since we stayed home due to COVID. Some legs do not lock in place. Some legs are nearly impossible to extend. Typical cheap, worthless Chinese trash. You can get a good step at Hatbor Freight for a LOT less money, except the legs do not extend. Don’t waste your money on this TRASH.
customer_reviews.author: Unhappy buyer

customer_reviews.title: Super stable, but very heavy to lift.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to use as a step to get into and out of a Uhaul truck on my cross country trip. It was super easy to use. Super sturdy. I was really impressed with its performance. It's a little heavy and I needed my co-pilot to hand it up to me once I got into the truck. But it was exactly what I needed.
customer_reviews.author: B. Rose

customer_reviews.title: perfect step for our casita camp trailer
customer_reviews.text: perfect step for our casita camp trailer. the one we had before was too tall, and if the ground sloped the wrong way, the door would hit the step. very sturdy, very light, folds up for travel., doubles as a door mat to knock the dirt off your shoes before coming in.
customer_reviews.author: Left Coast Geek

customer_reviews.title: Real Deal
customer_reviews.text: If you want a ROCK SOLID step that conforms to uneven terrain and adjusts for height, this is it! I weight 260#, and standing on this is as solid as standing on pavement.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: Hard to adjust
customer_reviews.text: Step is very sturdy. I would give 5 stars however the legs are very hard to adjust. The release is on both sides of leg and the buttons are small and I found it hard to adjust.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Built to last
customer_reviews.text: Very substantial and generously large. Legs fold in or out easily, but extending the legs is more difficult at least for me. To fold the legs in you will have to retract the legs also unless you are using this step at the low height setting.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. Gina Ann Orban

customer_reviews.title: Very strong, easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: Good quality step, extends easily, and the legs fold up for storage without any fight or risk of you being pinched like some spring-loaded types on the market. This step is height adjustable to get you the best transition to your RV steps at varied campgrounds where level dramatically changes for one site to another. My only complaint would be the price point, but in all, it is very sturdy and well made, so I can’t complain to much.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Veal

customer_reviews.title: Stable, easy to adjust, multiple uses, recomend
customer_reviews.text: OK a great product if you are a boon docker RV enthusiast. Very stable and easy to adjust. Plus it works well around your base camp when you are doing renovations. Very stable
customer_reviews.author: Jimbo 47

customer_reviews.title: Well made.
customer_reviews.text: Actully bought this for mywife to get in the shower.She didn't like that idea , so , its in the Rv ..but ..it will be a while till Spring , to try them our.
customer_reviews.author: ROP

customer_reviews.title: great step stool
customer_reviews.text: works for intended purposes my only complaint is the buttons to push to close the legs are hard to push and water will run out of it when folded so make sure you let it drain before putting it away.
customer_reviews.author: Jackie F

product_meta.title: Camco Adjustable Height Aluminum Platform Step- Supports Up to 1,000 lb., Includes Non-Slip Rubber Feet, Durable Construction, Easy to Store and Transport - (43676)
product_meta.description: Style:Adjustable StepCamco's aluminum platform step measures 19 x 14. 5-inches and provides up to 9-inches of additional height. Constructed of strong and sturdy aluminum, it supports up to 1, 000 lb. The legs fold out quickly and snap securely into place. With the legs folded out, the height is adjustable from 7. 5-inches – 9-inches for leveling on uneven surfaces. Non-slip rubber feet as well as grip tape provide a secure step. The step's legs fold in for compact storage and easy transport. Storage height is 3-inches.
feature_bullets: Maximum Support: Step can hold up to 1, 000 pounds
Durable Construction: Strong and sturdy aluminum construction with non slip rubber feet
Provides Great Stability: Grip tape allows a secure footing
Easy to Transport and Store: Folds to just 3 inches high
An Ideal Size: Platform measures 19 inch x 14. 5 inch. Adjustable Height: Height adjusts from 7. 5 inch – 9 inch for leveling on uneven surfaces

specifications.Cover Included: Camco Adjustable Height Aluminum Platform Step- Supports Up to 1,000lbs, Includes Non-Slip Rubber Feet, Durable Construction, Easy Storage and Transport
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.8 out of 5 stars1,715 ratings4.8 out of 5 stars
